properties.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 10:10AM EST until January 22 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Driftwood River...East Fork White River...Eel
River...Flatrock River...Mill Creek...Sugar Creek...Wabash River...
White River...Wildcat Creek...

.Minor to moderate flooding continues on many waterways in central
and southern Indiana as of Monday morning.  This is a result of
up to about 4 inches of rain that fell late last week and the
weekend.

The large majority of the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers
are either in flood or expected to flood, with some locations
reaching moderate flood stage.  Crests are expected to be the
highest since either February or June of 2019.

As of Monday morning, flooding had ended along many of the smaller
streams with minor to moderate flooding occurring along the main
stem rivers. The Wabash River was rising along the full length.  The
crest along the White River was near Ravenswood. The crest along the
East Fork White River was between Seymour and Rivervale. Flooding
along the lower portions of the White and Wabash River is likely to
continue through the end of the month.

Little or no precipitation is in the forecast through Thursday which
will allow smaller rivers to continue to recede this week.
Additional heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is possible this weekend
which could exacerbate ongoing flooding.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Edwardsport.
* until Wednesday January 22.
* At  7:00 AM Monday the stage was 21.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 23.8 feet by Wednesday evening then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Tuesday January 21.
* At 24.0 feet...Water is at critical stage for major agricultural
levees.  All roads are underwater in flood plain except U.S.
Highway 50. Evacuations are necessary from river cabins.  All
farmland on the unprotected sides of levees floods.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
